channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-17167] Pass mvcc to client when scan
item.description:
For the current implementation, if we use batch or allowPartial when scan, then the row level atomic can not be guaranteed if we need to restart a scan in the middle of a record due to region move or something else.

We can return the mvcc used to open scanner to client and client could use this mvcc to restart a scan to get row level atomic.
item.summary: Pass mvcc to client when scan

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: Yeah. I dislike exposing this internal sequence but we're talking read-only.... Makes reasoning about where client should read easier to do accounting on.
For now we will not expose it to the user level API.
Ya long pending issue and we discussed this over some thing jira also.. +1 for fixing it. Let the HBase client know abt readPnt is ok IMO.
Good point. The mvcc/seqid should be in the server/hfiles long enough. There were discussions on that previously as well.

Good news is that we discard the partial results if we restart the scanner in case allowPartialResults=false. Of course if we make it so that allow partials = true will also see the row atomically, it will be way better.
Also see HBASE-9797. We need to track the read point not just for partial results, but across rows as well in case multi-row transactions are used (like we do in meta for example).
The patch is simple. The most changes are protos and a format fix for ClientScanner.

And there is still a problem that we may read inconsistent data when restart a scanner. When compaction, we will get a smallestReadPoint. For all cells whose mvcc is greater than this value, we will never remove it, and not use it to delete any other values if it is a delete marker either. If a region is moved and start a compaction before we restart the scanner, we may have a smallestReadPoint which is greater than the mvcc of our scanner, if there is a delete marker in the range between the smallestReadPoint and the mvcc of our scanner, then we may lose some cells which should be returned to us.

I think this could be addressed in another issue(Yes yes, I do not have a good way to fix it right now!).

Thanks.
hmm.. So because of diff reasons, we are coming to a need to keep mvcc for ever There is another jira also.

-1 overall

Let me check the failed UTs.

The failing is because we change the mvcc read point of the scan object passed in directly. I do not think it is a good idea to modify the parameter of a read API. So I removed the comment


-   * Note that the passed {@link Scan}'s start row and caching properties

-   * maybe changed.

And cloned the scan object in the v1 patch.

Man, this keeps coming up. Lets just do it. For 2.0.0.
Can you open an issue on this Duo Zhang ? I'm not sure I follow but am sure there is an issue here.

I think that JIRA is
https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/HBASE-15968.
I think if we do this, then the way we do filtering and then consider version will also be solved? There were old JIRAs asking for that.
It is hard to describe the problem in the title of a issue... Let me try...

Oh no, we use the scan object to pass scan metrics so we will break this feature if we clone the scan object before we changing its fields...

Why not use ResultScanner to expose the metrics?

Thanks.

ResultScanner lasts the life of the Scan?

Yeah, Scan object accumulates all metrics for the life of the Scan.
I think so. We can add a method like getScanMetrics to the ResultScanner as in java8 we can give it a default implementation and will not break subclasses?

Anyway, let me revert the clone code and rewrite some UTs first. This patch could be committed to both master and branch-1. The clone and metrics change can be done in other issues and maybe 2.0 only.

Thanks.

Revert the clone of scan object. Modify several UTs to remove the reusing of scan object. But I think it is impossible to prevent user reusing the scan object, that't why we add a comment to tell user the start key may be changed. But it is not a good idea to tell user the mvcc read point is changed and you need to reset it as the methods are marked as private. So finally I decided to reset the mvcc read point in getScanner.

The findbugs warnings are in our shaded source. And the protoc error should be a bug of yetus or our pre commit script as there is no compile-protobuf profile in hbase-server.

So any other concerns? stack ramkrishna.s.vasudevan. Thanks.

Add a bridge class and change the visibility of the new methods added in Scan to package private.

Anoop Sam John Is this fine?

Thanks.

Yeah, the protoc error says...


...

[INFO] ------------------------------------------------------------------------

[INFO] BUILD SUCCESS

[INFO] ------------------------------------------------------------------------

[INFO] Total time: 18.296s

[INFO] Finished at: Tue Nov 29 04:20:52 UTC 2016

[INFO] Final Memory: 69M/1600M

[WARNING] The requested profile "compile-protobuf" could not be activated because it does not exist.

... complaining about missing protocs. We need to fix. HBASE-17119. There is another issue for skipping findbugs.

I looked at the patch +1 (thanks for the gymnastics that tried to keep setting mvcc package private). TestMvccConsistentScanner could go into the atomicity tests. Can do that later.

+1
Patch for branch-1.
Use scan.resetMvccReadPoint() instead of scan.setMvccReadPoint(0).
